captions.text:
BUT FIRST, THERE'S
BREAKING NEWS IN THE CASE

OF L.A. CLIPPERS OWNER
DONALD STERLING.

HE HAS COME UNDER FIRE FOR HIS
THOUGHTS ON THE

INSTAGRAM-ABILITY OF -- OF I
GUESS YOU WOULD CALL IT

GIRLFRIEND AND BLACK PERSON
FRIENDSHIP.

>> EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY, I AM
BANNING MR. STERLING FOR LIFE.

[CHEERS AND APPLAUSE]
>> Jon: YES!

>> FROM ANY ASSOCIATION WITH THE
CLIPPERS ORGANIZATION OR THE
NBA.

[CHEERS AND APPLAUSE]
♪
>> Jon: WOW.
SO MUCH EXCITEMENT OUT THERE.

SO MUCH EXCITEMENT OUT THERE
FROM THE ENTIRE WORLD AND EVEN
APPARENTLY THE PAST.
[ LAUGHTER ]

IT'S GOOD TO SEE THE DISTINCTION
BETWEEN FREE SPEECH AND
CONSEQUENCE FREE SPEECH.

MY GUESS IS THIS IS NOT THE
DEATH NELL FOR THIS COUNTRY'S

LONG AND PROUD TRADITION
OF CRAZY TALK.

>> IF I WERE IN CHARGE --
[LAUGHTER]

[CHEERS AND APPLAUSE]
>> Jon: ALL I CAN SAY THERE

IS THANK GOD THAT IS A
HYPOTHETICAL.

>> THEY WOULD KNOW THAT
WATERBOARDING IS HOW WE BAPTIZE
TERRORISTS.

[LAUGHTER]
>> JON: HUH?

THAT IS SARAH PALIN GIVING A
SPEECH WHERE SHE IS SOMEHOW

CONFLATING A SACRAMENT OF HER
FAITH

WITH TORTURE IN ORDER TO SOMEHOW
BRING THE FEAR OF GOD TO
RELIGIOUS EXTREMISTS.

[ LAUGHTER ]
I DON'T EVEN -- WHERE IS THAT

SPEECH EVEN APPROPRIATE AT AN AL
QAEDA RECRUITMENT HOW-TO VIDEO
WORKSHOP?

AT THE YEARLY GATHERING OF THE
DUMMOLOS OR MAYBE SHE'S GIVING
ONE OF THOSE FAMED HUH TALKS.

THEY ARE LIKE TED TALKS EXCEPT
THEY MAKE NO SENSE.
WELL, SO -- TED TALKS.

[LAUGHTER]
SO, WHAT ELSE DID THE FORMER

VICE PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE OF
ONE OF TWO MAJOR NATIONAL

PARTIES TELL WHOEVER IT IS SHE
IS TALKING TO.

>> JOE BIDEN, REMEMBER THIS HE
TELLING WOMEN BEFORE AN ASSAULT

JUST A FIRE WARNING SHOT UNTIL
THE COPS SHOW UP.
JUST AIM UP IN THE AIR.
THAT WAS HIS DIRECTIVE.
HIS ADVICE.

WELL FINE, JOE SQUIRT GUN, IF
YOUR RAPIST IS A BIRD.

[LAUGHTER]
>> Jon: SHE SEEMS NICE.

[LAUGHTER]
SO I SEE.

WELL, THE FORMER ALASKA GOVERNOR
WITH A CLEAR AND QUITE RYE

REFERENCE TO THE WELL KNOWN
GREEK MYTH LEDA AND THE SWAN.

ZEUS IN THE FORM OF A SWAN
FORCED HIMSELF ON LEDA

DAUGHTER OF THESTIUS, KING OF
AETOLIA LEADING TO THE BIRTH OF

HELEN OF TROY YADA YADA YADA
SMASH CUT CHRISTOPHER COLUMBUS
DISCOVERS AMERICA AND THUS THE

FOUNDING FATHERS CREATE THE
GREATEST COUNTRY GOD HAS EVER
GIVEN TO THE PEOPLE OF EARTH.

WELL PLAYED, GOVERNOR, YOU DO
READ, ALL OF THEM.

comments.author: Weird Squid

comments.text:
It's amazing how stupid people can be. They see the word "freedom" but 
don't think beyond the word. They don't take concepts and view them within 
the context called REALITY.

"Free" to the common man might simply mean "free", but realistically, and 
importantly CONSTITUTIONALLY, there's an asterisk next to the word.

Yes, you can write in a Huffington Post article that "Obama is a terrorist" 
and the local, state, or federal government can't put you into jail for it. 
You have such a "freedom" of speech.

But don't expect the Huffington Post not to fire your dumb ass for making 
such a ridiculous claim, especially if Huffpo's sales take a hit.

So no, freedom doesn't mean you can literally do whatever you want. 
Freedoms come with responsibilities and limits, even in the so-called "land 
of the free."﻿
comments.author: Montesama314

comments.author: Montesama314

comments.text:
+Chan Soman
*a lot of people in the soviet union would have been offended by pro 
democratic statementsc*

What people? The NKVD? Then sure, they'd probably take offense and you'd 
probably be killed or imprisoned in Siberia.

But the masses? If they knew communism, which you obviously don't, then pro 
democratic statements would be seen as heroic. See theory of government in 
communism is a dictatorship of the proletariat. The proletariat being the 
workers, the peasants, the masses.

Dictatorship of the masses, rule of majority... Democracy by any other name.

Hence why Stalin executed or imprisoned the communists who told the 
Bolsheviks they were the same as the tsar. Because they were. The USSR was 
authoritarian state capitalism, and Stalin didn't even pretend it was 
communism. He called what he did "Marxism-Leninism", i.e. authoritarian 
state capitalism under a popular name.

*tl;dr*

If you want to open your mouth then might I suggest looking up what you're 
talking about first?

comments.author: Chan Soman

comments.text:
+Chan Soman He wasn't hurting anyone? SO WHAT? You don't need to be 
"inciting violence or oppression" to be seen as a blow to a private 
organization's reputation or profits.

If the NBA (or any other private organization) sees a guy as a burden, he 
can get cut. And when you say stupid and offensive things and word gets 
out, don't expect people to not be offended. If you didn't want to risk 
hurting yourself with your own words, you shouldn't have said them in the 
first place.

Besides, I don't see a problem with being against hate speech. If the NBA 
wanted to stand against the "stupid" crowd as you call them, it could have, 
but it made its choice. Of course, if you wanna defend Mr. Sterling, that's 
YOUR freedom of speech in action.
comments.author: Montesama314

comments.text:
This is not the same thing. This was a private conversation and the 
commissioner was pressured into firing him by the angry stupid anti hate 
speech crowd. He wasn't inciting anyone to violence or oppression I don't 
know why his career needs to be linked to that.
comments.author: Chan Soman

comments.text:
+GhostInTheShell29 Yes, that's pretty much what I said. That's what I mean 
by an asterisk next to the word "free." The disclaimer might best be stated 
as:

"*Warning: This amendment does not protect against private consequences of 
your own stupidity."
comments.author: Montesama314

comments.text:
The Right to free speech is clearly defined in the constitution and the 
only acceptable exemptions to that rule are inflamatory remarks clearly 
threatening violence.

The Right, is a protection from the government.  It does not or should not 
come with limits like saying Obama's a terrorist, or Calling an ethnic 
minority a racial slur.  Or for saying batshit stupid things like Palin 
does.

There is no astericks.

The Right of the huffington post to fire someone for saying what they don't 
like is not a government decision, The Right of people to critize someone 
for being racist is not a government decision.  The Right of people to not 
vote for someone because they are an idiot is not a government decision.

They aren't 1st amendment issues, because the speech is not being censured 
or punished in any way by the government.
comments.author: GhostInTheShell29

comments.text: +Isaac Planck Define your concept of "real world"
